description:
Contemporary public housing for Hackney Council. 
Two medium-rise, brick-built urban buildings of 116 mixed-tenure homes with landscaped communal spaces and a revised street network.

Zoom meeting link: https://bit.ly/36N9PKo

events.name: Virtual tour of Branch Place by Senior Architect, Niall Anderson

factsheet.heading: History and the Colville Estate Masterplan
paragraphs: Branch Place provides the first replacement homes in the Colville Estate Masterplan, a major urban renewal providing 925 homes (replacing 438 existing homes), new street networks, public green space and carparking provision.

The revised estate replaces a series of run-down 1950's buildings which were in poor repair and organised in a way which made the estate feel inward looking and closed off from their surroundings. The estate re-design provides better quality council homes and re-connects buildings back into the local neighbourhood.

factsheet.heading: Urban form
paragraphs:
The project is conceived as a family of two buildings - Clift House and Dorchester House. Their design balances consistency of urban form with a variety of architectural character between each building, achieved through articulated roof lines, facades and subtle variations in 
brick tone.

factsheet.heading: Materiality
paragraphs: Buildings are crafted from a palette of high-quality tenure-blind materials: brickwork, metalwork and timber. This selected palette was chosen to create attractive and robust council homes which sit comfortably in their context.

A copper mansard roof on Dorchester House (the building next to Regent’s Canal) reflects the undulating roofscape of neighbouring historic warehouse buildings and marks an entrance to the revised Colville Estate.

factsheet.heading: A revised street network
paragraphs: A comprehensive street and public realm network was created as part of this phase. A neighbourhood route running east-west forms a vital link through the scheme while pedestrian priority streets run north-south to reconnect the estate back into the local area. Street-accessed homes enliven the public realm and contribute to a sense of place.

factsheet.heading: Community Engagement
paragraphs: The project has been characterised by working incredibly closely with the local TRA and Colville Estate community on the re-design from concept through to delivery.
Within the OPA for the masterplan, the establishment of a Design Code and Residents Charter locked in quality and design intent into each future phase.
